author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Farnsworth hosts Fall Family Festival
text:
Farnsworth hosts Fall Family Festival Oct 09, 2015 Thanks to a weeklong Shoestring Theater workshop preceding it, this year’s Farnsworth Fall Family Festival parade should have some impressive puppet participants. 
Rockland — The Farnsworth Art Museum invites everyone to attend its fifth annual Fall Family Festival Saturday, Oct. 17, from 3 to 6 p.m. in the downtown museum’s sculpture garden, free of charge. 
The Farnsworth’s sculpture garden will be transformed into the Fall Family Festival grounds, offering free-style pumpkin carving, face painting, crafts and live music. Uproot Pizza company will be on hand for those longing for a warm, tasty meal. 
At 5:30 p.m., a parade will take place on Main Street, departing from the sculpture garden. Families are invited to participate in the parade by wearing costumes and masks. Some masks will be made available thanks to Shoestring Theater, which will be teaching a week-long free workshop in the days leading up to the festival and parade. Immediately following the parade, the group will return to the sculpture garden for the annual lighting of the pumpkins. 
In case of rain, activities will take place in the Gamble Education Center, located at the corner of Grace and Union streets. For more information, call the museum’s education department at 596-0949. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
